displayProperties.name: G'day mate
displayProperties.description:
So, this is new, yep. I've built a component through which to annoy you all through direct messages. It might seem familiar, and that's intentional. This is a measured test.

Follow me on Twitter @justrealmilk if you're feelin' it.

—Thanks for using Braytech!

displayProperties.name: Season of Opulence
displayProperties.description:
This Season, Emperor Calus beckons Guardians to prove their worth by pitting them against foes in his Menagerie. He'll send Guardians on treasure hunts throughout the system to unlock the power of the Chalice of Opulence—upgrades that allow you to choose the type of gear you earn.

_Tend to your Imperial summons immediately._

displayProperties.name: Pride month
displayProperties.description:
June is Pride month. For more information on Pride month, use your preferred search engine, as I'm not qualified to properly disseminate all of the related information.

What I can speak to is what Pride means to me, your friendly neighbourhood Braytech developer. I'll do what I can to temper my language. It's actually very easy to abide by the following guidelines.

- Don't be a wanker
- Treat each other with respect
- Don't use slurs (fag, faggot, gay, homo, are all hateful derogatory terms)
- Next time you think to make a joke with your friends, consider first that it's only funny if **everyone** can be amused and feel comfortable
- Everyone has a right to play Destiny in a safe environment

You may notice that these guidelines have little to do with being gay or otherwise and that isn't a coincidence. Be a nice Guardian to everyone. 

*If you disagree with any of these points, you can stop using Braytech immediately.*

displayProperties.name: New Clan Roster
displayProperties.description: New and improved _Clan Roster_ now available. You can sort by different columns by tapping the column header names. Let me know what you think/if it explodes.

displayProperties.name: New Chalice Recipes Tool
displayProperties.description: Did you know Braytech has a new tool for decrypting the Menagerie rolls? No? Find it under the menu—click _More_ if you're a desktop user!
